revised_title: The Evolution of Modern Humans in Northwestern Africa and the Impact of Chronometric Dating
tldr: This article discusses the evolution of modern humans in northwestern Africa, focusing on the Aterian industries and their connection to the emergence of anatomically modern humans. The author reviews the available evidence, including electron spin resonance (ESR) dating and thermoluminescence dating, to establish a timeline for the Aterian industries and their relationship with the Mousterian. The article highlights the importance of understanding the chronology of these industries in the context of human evolution in the region.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Human Evolution
